content.question: Let <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> be the function given by <math alttext="r open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator 2 open parentheses x minus 3 close parentheses open parentheses x plus 1 close parentheses open parentheses x minus 1 close parentheses over denominator open parentheses x plus 1 close parentheses open parentheses x minus 1 close parentheses squared open parentheses x plus 2 close parentheses end fraction"><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math>. Which of the following is true about the location of holes in the graph of <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane?

choices.label: The graph of <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> has exactly one hole, which is at <math alttext="x equals negative 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>.

The graph of <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> has exactly two holes, which are at <math alttext="x equals negative 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="x equals 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>.

The graph of <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> has exactly two holes, which are at <math alttext="x equals negative 2"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="x equals 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>.

The graph of <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> has exactly two holes, which are at <math alttext="x equals 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="x equals 3"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>.

content.answer: The graph of <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> has exactly one hole, which is at <math alttext="x equals negative 1"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
